'Proboscidea' is a genus of flowering plant in the family Martyniaceae, some of
whose species are known as 'devil's claw', 'devil's horn', 'ram's horn', or
'unicorn plant'. The plants produce long, hooked seed pods. The hooks catch on
the feet of animals, and as the animals walk, the pods are ground or crushed
open, dispersing the seeds. The name devil's claw is shared with the South
African plant [[Harpagophytum procumbens]].
